results.title: Police horses: who cares?
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Reg Boulter and Vivian McWaters
results.brief_description:
Film opens with countryside shots at dawn and then goes into a fast-paced montage sequence of Police Horses in action with a funk soundtrack. Features footage of the horses in country, urban and city settings.

The work of a Victorian Department of Agriculture vet is then spotlighted as he tends to injured horses in the field and in a surgery/lab. Includes footage of a horse being X-Rayed who has an injured hoof.

Switches to the Victorian Police band in action and a their drum-carrying horse. Shots of kids enjoying the band play in an outdoor parade.

Then goes to show a Police Horse trainer at work at the Attwood Department of Agriculture stables. In the background of this training sequence planes from the nearby airport take-off and land in the background.

Similar training seqeunce takes place at the St Kilda Rd barracks with four horses being ridden. Up-beat synthesiser soundtrack. City-scape in the background, featuring the National Gallery of Victoria. This is followed by a more formal performance with full dress uniforms and big-band music. Horses and riders then escort the Queen as she travels in a car on parade down two city streets.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Reg Boulter and Vivian McWaters

results.title: The ABC of puppets
results.creator_credit: Portia Hawley and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: A film in two parts. Part 1 illustrates the processes of making a glove puppet in detail. Part 2 shows the construction of a stage for the puppets and their manipulation. The story of Hansel and Gretel is performed.
results.description: A film in two parts. Part 1 illustrates the processes of making a glove puppet in detail. Part 2 shows the construction of a stage for the puppets and their manipulation. The story of Hansel and Gretel is performed.

results.title: The ABC of It
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner, Brian Adams and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: An impressionistic look at the many aspects of the Australian Broadcasting Commission, showing film crews on location and in the studio; collation and broadcasting of daily news; events; ethnic radio; orchestral performances; sporting events coverage; and rating surveys.
results.description: An impressionistic look at the many aspects of the Australian Broadcasting Commission, showing film crews on location and in the studio; collation and broadcasting of daily news; events; ethnic radio; orchestral performances; sporting events coverage; and rating surveys.

results.title: Abakanowicz in Australia
results.creator_credit: Christopher McGill, Malcolm Otton, Crafts Council of Australia and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Polish artist Magdalena Abakanowicz prepares for an exhibition of her work in Australia. We see her exhibits of large rope, hessian and string three-dimensional forms. She comments upon her intended purpose in working with such materials. Narrated by Margaret Throsby.

results.title: Festliches Nuernberg = Nuremberg rally
results.brief_description: Coverage of the 1937 Nuremberg Rally. The film opens with views of Nuremberg immediately prior to the rally. Hitler is seen arriving in Nuremberg by aeroplane and driving through crowd lined streets to a rousing reception. Propaganda shots of factory production, farming activities etc., precede coverage of the rally itself. Shots of massed troops parading before Hitler are followed by a display of military weapons etc. The film closes with night scenes of the rally and a fireworks display. There is no commentary.

results.title: Picking grapes
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Jack Keane
results.brief_description: Shot close to the Murry river. Predominantly features instructional sequences on how to pick and process grapes. Nice shots featuring contrasting Orange and Green colours in the soil/grapes. Four soundtracks accompany picture; Italian, German, English and Hungarian.

results.title: 1893-1901: early Edison films
results.creator_credit: Thomas A. Edison and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: A compilation of 19 Thomas Edison films, some made for use in kinetoscopes others for public projection, averaging less than one minute each. Most are single shot films except ‘McKinley’s Inauguration’ and ‘Admiral Dewey at Manila Bay’ which are made up of several shots. Includes “Washing the Baby” (1893) and “Inauguration of President McKinley” (1896) and what is regarded as the first advertising film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thomas A. Edison and British Film Institute

results.title: 500 million years beneath the sea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
Jacques Cousteau and his divers survey the 500 million years of life beneath the sea and explain how man’s exploitation of the natural resources of the coastal zones of the world are jeopardising this life.

results.title: 250 million years ago: permian life in Australia
results.creator_credit: Harold Fletcher, Lex Halliday and Australian Museum
results.brief_description: The permian deposits found most notably in the Kimberley’s, North-West Basin and the Hunter Valley are some of the world’s richest fossil deposits. Mostly marine, but some fresh-water and land strata fossils are included. Typical fossils such as butterfly shells, starfish, lace coral, as well as plants and coal seams are highlighted.
